column4: I am having a real b*tch of a time getting edubuntu 6.10 to run on my machine.  Can someone make some suggestions?
Everything installs fine, but when I go to boot, immediately after the memory check and disk initialization I get a blinking cursor and nothing else.
platform? motherboard? type of drive? partitioning schema?
default partition scheme.  Erase entire disk and use LVM.  it is a IBM Netvista 6350-11U machine
wait, do you even see a GRUB boot screen?
re-install, but create a 250MB partition *outside of LVM* and *at the beginning of the disk*
make a seperate partition to use as /boot. create that partition outside of LVM. put it at the beginning of the disk.
when I create the /boot partition, do I automatically partition the rest of the "Free Space"?
Do I also have to set the bootable flag?
OK.  Installed but still just a blinking cursor when booting.
